data.summary:
Frontend Developer with over 7 years of experience working with modern technologies like React, Next.js, Vue, Angular, and web animations. 

Extensive expertise in building web applications, optimizing performance through server-side rendering, caching improvements, and implementing scalable solutions. 

Skilled in improving system efficiency, boosting user retention with interactive animations, and enhancing usability to deliver an excellent user experience. Knowledge working with Artificial Intelligence (AI).

If you are looking for someone creative, proactive, and capable of solving problems, you came to the right place.
data.headline: Frontend Developer at DEPT® | React, Svelte, Vue, Angular

geo.full: Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires Province, Argentina

educations.description: Cursos de programación, diseño, marketing, desarrollo web, Frontend, Backend, Desarrollo Móvil, UX, Usabilidad.
Estudiante de Computación, Universidad de Carabobo.
educations.activities: Calculo, Matemática Discreta, Desarrollo de Habilidades Directivas, Algoritmo...

position.title: Frontend Developer
position.description:
I played a pivotal role in developing a dynamic website for whoop.com using NextJS 13.4 within a monorepo structure. This project was integrated to Contentful, empowering clients to easily customize their page content. The project's standout challenge was creating modules/components enriched with animations such as scrolling effects, carousels, and parallax features using libraries such as framer motion and gsap, those animations demanded me a fusion of creativity and technical expertise. This site was successfully launched on August 2023.

Also, I was working on another project to fix some bugs and add more features to an existent project for Vizio and Inscape. The technologies that I worked with are React and Web Components.

Currently, I am working with the Shell Recharge team (formerly Volta Charging) to develop an app for monitoring electric vehicle charging stations. The app, built with Next.js and Apollo within a monorepo, tracks the status of key station components like computers, routers, and chargers.

position.title: Frontend Developer
position.description: At Coco Pago (aka Coco), I played an important role in the development of cocomercado.com—a groundbreaking platform powered by NuxtJS 2 and Vue 2. This platform serves the Venezuelan diaspora by enabling them to directly purchase foods and products from local merchants in Venezuela for their families back home, eliminating the need for cross-border shipping. My contributions spanned both projects cocomercado.com and its backoffice. This backoffice was a React-based platform that empowers merchants to manage inventory, set prices, and control store operations.

position.title: Frontend Developer
position.description:
During my tenure at Santander, I assumed a pivotal role in spearheading the development of a versatile React-based chat system. This chat system was designed with the strategic goal of seamless integration across various applications and websites within the bank's ecosystem, regardless the technology with they were made. To realize this vision, I championed the utilization of microfrontend architecture, allowing the chat to be independently deployed and enabling us to maintain our release cycles autonomously, thereby reducing dependencies on host projects and without losing the ability to keep the communication between apps.

Navigating the integration of the chat into diverse environments posed a significant challenge, particularly in the case of a monolithic AngularJS application and mobile apps developed in Java and Swift.

position.title: Mobile Developer
position.description:
During my freelancing tenure with Workana, I involved on a series of diverse projects, primarily centered around mobile app development using Ionic 2 and React Native frameworks. One notable project involved creating an app similar to Uber, where I leveraged Ionic 2 to implement functionalities that required the use of GPS and Google Maps integration.

The other project made in React Native was a very specific job to fix some issues related to writing and reading tags through the NFC technology. 

Get more details about my experience at my profile:
Profile: https://dartiles.link/workana

position.title: Frontend Developer
position.description: At Lagash, I was entrusted with an Angular-based project tailored for the bank's call center personnel. Given my extensive experience with Angular, I was an important player to my coworkers to help them on any question about the frontend side.

position.title: Frontend Developer
position.description:
During my tenure at the Grupo Nepuntobiz, I was actively engaged in two significant projects that showcased my expertise in both AngularJS and Angular 2. In the E-learning initiative, I played a key role in developing a platform that seamlessly integrated with Moddle, enabling the retrieval of modules, courses, and videos. This experience deepened my understanding of Angular's capabilities.

In the field of telecommunications, I further expanded my Angular 2 skills by working on a project that dealt with real-time data. I faced some challenges by presenting real-time information but also visualize historical data through graphical representations. This marked my initiation into handling real-time systems and data visualization.

givenRecommendation.text: Juan was a great colleague. His focus on the frontend and his leadership skills are awesome. Juan is a responsible person who cares about the products he oversees, prioritizes quality, and meets deadlines to ship products on time. Working with him is a pleasure.

recommendee.occupation: Desarrollador Frontend en Midas Labs | Desarrollo Web, Frontend

givenRecommendation.text:
I had the pleasure to work together with Juan, he was an amazing coworker, very responsible and very committed with his job. Juan is a person so proactive, he always found a solution to any issue that came up. 

I had a good time working with him and would like to have more coworkers like him.

Vickler is a very fast learner, a good partner, and a person who gets along very well with challenges.

If you are looking for a person willing to take on new challenges, you are contacting the right person.

recommendee.occupation: Software Engineer | Web3 & Smart Contract Specialist | Building dApps on EVM

givenRecommendation.text:
Miguel (midudev) es una persona muy humilde y gran profesional, la capacidad que tiene para enseñar y compartir conocimientos es realmente increíble, inspira mucha motivación y es de gran ayuda especialmente para quienes empiezan en el mundo de la programación, sin embargo no importa la experiencia que tengas siempre aprenderás algo de él.

Como profesional sabe mucho sobre javascript y cualquiera puede dar fe de esto al ver sus videos de Youtube. 

Personalmente he aprendido muchos tips y cosas que no sabía gracias a él, las cuales hoy en día pongo en práctica y me ayuda a entender mejor el porque de las cosas. 

No hay que pensarlo dos veces si quieres trabajar con Miguel.

recommendee.occupation: Software Engineer and Web Developer. Awarded as GitHub Star, Microsoft MVP, and Google Developer Expert.

givenRecommendation.text: Leydy es una persona muy comprometida y responsable en lo que hace, muy detallista y gran persona. Excelente compañera de trabajo.

recommendee.occupation: Team Leadership | Scrum Master | Software Engineer | Full-stack Dev | Angular | Node.js | AWS Enthusiast

receivedRecommendation.text: I had the pleasure of working with and managing Diego for about two years. My team needed a skilled React engineer to help us ship a lot of new features and parity work for a large platform at Volta/SRS. Diego was an absolutely incredible fit for our team, and a very talented software engineer to boot. Diego has the very important skill of being able to follow when required, and to lead and take initiative when required. This helped us grow our codebase and product in a clean and sustainable way, and with very minimal tech debt. Diego found the right balance here; he was able to follow the existing patterns and best practices we had established, but also took the initiative to suggest new features, libraries and architecture patterns when he thought it was a good idea. And it turns out, they were all good ideas! So we implemented as many of his feature ideas concepts as we could, and the product, and tech team, are better off as a result. I'm excited for what's next in Diego's career, he will be a great asset to any team lucky enough to have him.

recommender.occupation: Lead Software Engineer @ Shell Recharge Solutions | Full-Stack Development

receivedRecommendation.text:
I had the pleasure of working closely with Diego for nearly a year, and I can confidently say he's a brilliant mind in the frontend tech stack. His professionalism is unmatched, and he has an incredible eye for detail.
If you're looking for a frontend developer who excels and leaves no detail overlooked, Diego is your go-to person.

Diego es un desarrollador talentoso y completo. Su código y ética de trabajo son de primera categoría. Además de programar, tiene buen ojo para el diseño y la animación. Una cosa más: Diego te hará reír... todo... el... tiempo. Incluso durante los momentos más estresantes, su personalidad mantiene a todos con el ánimo alto. Diego ha sido un miembro valioso para el equipo de Pago. Espero seguir trabajando con él en el futuro.

recommender.occupation: Software Engineer | Web3 & Smart Contract Specialist | Building dApps on EVM

receivedRecommendation.text: Diego es muy responsable y colaborador con una capacidad asombrosa para generar soluciones, siempre con ideas innovadoras, muy atento y considerado, también muy alegre, de esos que hacen del ambiente de trabajo, un mejor lugar.
